definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: I got tired of working and threw up my job.
sentences.chinese: 工作丰富化和工作扩大化应加以区分。

sentences.english: Job enrichment should be distinguished from job enlargement.
sentences.chinese: 工作丰富化和工作扩大化应加以区分。

sentences.english: There are growing signs of more broadly-based popular unrest.
sentences.chinese: 越来越多的迹象表明，民众骚乱呈现扩大化趋势。

sentences.english: 'I don't know why people see a problem with Gilberto.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道外界为什么把吉尔伯托的问题扩大化。

sentences.english: The expansion of consumer credit leads to the climbing of consumers' over-indebtedness.
sentences.chinese: 消费信用经济的扩大化导致消费者的负债额上升。

definition: to publicize/openness (of government, PRC equivalent of "glasnost")
to intensify/to become acute/to come to a head
to come to the surface/to become apparent
contradictions between ourselves and the enemy/Either you are for us or against us.
to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas/to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
ever more critical/problems get more and more intense
internal contradiction among the people (pretext for a purge)
pinyin: ren2 min2 nei4 bu4 mao2 dun4
